p: Practitioners and administrators play an important role in bridging DRR and CCA [ 33]. Practitioners and administrators working towards improving and securing population health will be vital contributors to effective implementation of DRR and CCA strategies [ 61]. These public health professionals are experienced in dealing with risk. It has been suggested that public health professionals could thus be readily familiar with concepts and approaches that are commonly used in DRR and CCA [ 61, 67, 103, 135, 136]. Additionally, the public health sector is experienced in addressing complex problems through multi-sectoral action [ 137]. As a result, public health professionals are in a strong position to establish and sustain links between and bridging DRR and CCA in health.
